column4: Trying to remove a package on my system that was installed using apt, however, something is misconfiguration and it doesn't let me uninstall, please take a look at my pastebin http://paste.ubuntu.com/534547/. Can anyone help?
what was the actual command you used here?
originally tried aptitude purge, than -f update/upgrade to try and see if apt would correct the package, however it doesn't now I just want to force remove the package
can you do 'sudo apt-get -f install' and post the output?
post = paste at http://paste.ubuntu.com/
I'm able to install/uninstall that package on lucid 64 without any problem if that helps you
you have to find out which "subprocess" dpkg doesn't have permission to execute, then find out why
on my other comp it works, I don't know why root would be failing on this package
you can only discover that using dpkg output - aptitude/apt-get doesn't give you enough information
so dpkg -i package name?
that's probably a good place to start
paste that output and I'll look with you
the pastebin show the output of both dpkg purge and install not much info given http://paste.ubuntu.com/534552/
first do 'sudo apt-get install denyhosts', then 'sudo dpkg -i /var/cache/apt/archives/denyhosts_2.6-6.1ubuntu1_all.deb' and please paste that
i've also posted the output of aptitude reinstall http://paste.ubuntu.com/534554/
still there?
yes I'm here, but I'm not sure what to advise...  I've not seen the "package list missing" errors before :-/
neither have I specially a package in the repo, will stick around and ask again soon, it bugs me to have unmet package(s)
try the advice in #2 at this forums thread, then try again: http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=1558616
sorry about earlier I became engrossed in something else just noticed your message will check that link
no prob - I'm doing other things too ;-0
didn't work I have a good hunch it's something with apt, will be loading the snapshot image I made earlier before doing system settings, it will take long but at least it will be working
good luck!
